headline.print_headline: Politicians’ Prescriptions for Marijuana Defy Doctors and Data
headline.main: Politicians’ Prescriptions for Marijuana Defy Doctors and Data

docs.abstract: Some doctors and researchers say that legalization of marijuana use by New York and many other states for patients with array of ailments, including epilepsy, cancer and Parkinson's, is not supported by evidence that drug treats symptoms of listed maladies; experts say that lawmakers have acted largely on basis of animal studies and heart-wrenching anecdotes.
docs.lead_paragraph: There is no rigorous scientific evidence that marijuana effectively treats the symptoms of many of the illnesses for which states have authorized its use.
docs.snippet: There is no rigorous scientific evidence that marijuana effectively treats the symptoms of many of the illnesses for which states have authorized its use.

headline.print_headline: Issue of Pay for 2 Sets of Workers Tugs at Palestinian Pact
headline.main: Issue of Pay for 2 Sets of Workers Tugs at Palestinian Pact

docs.abstract: Reconciliation deal intended to end bitter schism between Hamas and Fatah faction that dominates Palestinian Authority faces financial dilemma; Palestinian Prime Min Rami Hamdallah says he does not have enough money to pay both workers hired by Hamas and those employed by Palestinian Authority.

byline.original: By FARES AKRAM and JODI RUDOREN
byline.contributor: Fares Akram reported from Gaza City, and Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Palestinian prime minister says he does not have enough money to pay both workers hired by Hamas and those employed by the Palestinian Authority.
docs.snippet: The Palestinian prime minister says he does not have enough money to pay both workers hired by Hamas and those employed by the Palestinian Authority.

headline.main: Vitamin D Screening Not Backed by Expert Panel

docs.abstract: The United States Preventive Services Task Force decided not to recommend routine testing for vitamin D levels in part because it was not clear whether otherwise healthy adults with low levels actually benefit from taking supplements of the vitamin.

keywords.value: United States Preventive Services Task Force
keywords.name: organizations

docs.snippet: The United States Preventive Services Task Force decided not to recommend routine testing for vitamin D levels in part because it was not clear whether otherwise healthy adults with low levels actually benefit from taking supplements of the vitamin.

headline.seo: Rare Opportunity as Rookie New York Firefighter Faces First Test

docs.abstract: Probationary New York City Firefighter Jordan Sullivan went an unusual 96 days in the field before encountering a live fire; for firefighters, first fire is like a police officer's first arrest or a lawyer's first jury trial; description of how Sullivan handled his first blaze at Wyckoff Gardens housing project in Brooklyn noted.
docs.lead_paragraph: Jordan Sullivan’s decade-long dream of joining the Fire Department came true, but then he had an unusually long wait before he could prove himself.
docs.snippet: Jordan Sullivan’s decade-long dream of joining the Fire Department came true, but then he had an unusually long wait before he could prove himself.
